page.title: 04Hill Farming in Cheshire.
page.content: The farm houses themselves are scattered among the hillsides and some are even found on the exposed tops, where they are vulnerable to the full force of the elements.The temperature on the hills is a degree or two below that of the Cheshire Plain and the chill factor of the wind,often lowers it still further.Shelter belts of trees have been planted by a number of the farmers,to give their houses a measure of protection from the wind.Built of locally quarried sandstone,the farmsteads give the appearance of rugged,sturdy characters,which stand sentinel in their isolation, surveying the landscape and defying the climate's harsh blast.
